medical_history.chief_complaint: Cold-induced sweating syndrome type 1 (CISS1) characterized by profuse sweating in cold environments.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented at 1 year of age with hypotonia at birth and severe feeding difficulties. Over the years, feeding difficulties and hypotonia improved, but he continued to experience deficient sweating in warm environments, heat intolerance, hyperpyrexia, and abundant sweating in cold or stressful conditions. At age 13, dorsal kyphoscoliosis was evident.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypotonia at birth, severe feeding difficulties, dorsal kyphoscoliosis.
medical_history.family_history: Healthy parents; a brother died at 3 months from broncho-pulmonary infection and had facial dysmorphisms and hypotonia.
